title: Inventory Management System
description:
Create an inventory management system using multiple classes.

## Requirements

1. Create a `Product` class:
   - `__init__(self, name, price, quantity)` - Initialize product details
   - `get_value(self)` - Return price * quantity
   - `__str__(self)` - Return "{name}: ${price} x {quantity}"

2. Create an `Inventory` class:
   - `__init__(self)` - Initialize empty product dictionary
   - `add_product(self, product)` - Add a Product to inventory (use name as key)
   - `remove_product(self, name)` - Remove product by name
   - `get_product(self, name)` - Return product or None if not found
   - `total_value(self)` - Return sum of all product values
   - `__len__(self)` - Return number of products

## Example Usage

```python
apple = Product("Apple", 1.50, 100)
banana = Product("Banana", 0.75, 50)

inv = Inventory()
inv.add_product(apple)
inv.add_product(banana)

print(len(inv))           # 2
print(inv.total_value())  # 187.50
print(inv.get_product("Apple"))  # Apple: $1.5 x 100
```
